title: With the changes to AP items, can we get a explanation as to why there is no AP QSS
body:
There arent any AP versions of {{item:3140}} {{item:3139}} 
Someone else mentioned that in the LCK both {{champion:13}} and {{champion:8}} took {{item:3139}}.  They had overall less damage than if they were to build an actual AP item for that slot but decided too as having that active was just too important.

replies.body:
I think the issue is because if there was an AP version of QSS, it would likely devolve into a lot of AP champions going mid to rush it. It then becomes a match of "who wins before the other gets the QSS upgrade".

That's just my assumption, anyway.

Assuming the stats are even worth it. You dont want the active of QSS every game. That argument can be applied to {{item:3139}}. ADCs dont rush it every game or take it every game. It will have niche similar to {{item:3157}} {{item:3102}} {{item:3001}}.
there ya go. you already have items for that scenario then...

Do, um. Do you, uh, know, how a Malzahar works? Because he's one of the main reasons why people need a QSS. 

If you Zhonya's in front of him, he can just wait it out then ult. If you have Banshee passive, he's got his Q or E to pop it, then ult.
Then maybe don't add a new item cause one champion can click CC you?
One champion does not warrant a completely new item that would most likely destroy the game. Change Malzahar, not the mid meta.

To add to this.

It's also just malz that's an outlier causing this problem. He is the ONLY reason why QSS is needed. It's better to nerf/change Malzahar than adding an item that might break the REST OF THE GAME. For example twisted fate or annie, who rely on stuns, might be too weak if AP QSS exists.

the roles aren't the same thing. homogenizing them and minimizing their differences isn't necessarily the direction i think riot should go in

The problem with trying to compare {{item:2420}}{{item:3157}}  with {{item:3140}} is that there is an AD version of the item and in some cases its even better at they have to KILL you to burn it and you arent required to activate it whenever and restores mana as well. Its a better {{item:3157}} infact.

If a AP champ has to take  QSS and cant build it further they are not only having to waste a slot for a valuable active but have to choose between damage or the active when AD champs cant. 

Riot has been trying to homogenize the roles for a while now. The new AP changes and the addition to Magic pen buffs and MR nerfs are the proof. They want to make it as even as possible without breaking anything. Having a AP QSS item wont be broken imo.

> [{quoted}](name=Sirsir,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=yW7coPxG,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2018-02-07T20:55:06.375+0000)

 The setback with {{item:3102}} is that any spell gets rid of it meaning you either stay out of the fight or hope someone doesnt hit you with a regular spell before applying CC. 

Just cause GA is 5 minutes doesnt mean its passive is any less strong. Its a zilean ult that restores mana/health and does what zhonyas does and is cheaper than it. 

Are they similar? Sure. But that still doesnt mean there cant be a QSS item for them. {{item:3091}} is another "defensive/offensive" option as it offers MR and shredding.

The point is riot has been trying to make things even in terms of items. This would just be another one of those things. If the active of QSS is that valuable that AP champs are willing to have less damage and get useless stats for it then it should be in both categories. If it was a tank items that offered tank stats then I wouldnt really question it as both could take it and benefit from it.
9/10 times GA is not going to be used how you described, whereas zhonyas can be used a lot more liberally

I understand that. But part of the plus's of the item compared to zhonyas is that it doesnt need to be activated and must be take off first before you kill them. Someone who has zhonyas that got cc chained can die without ever getting a chance to activate it. Whereas someone with GA doesnt have to worry about as its a safety net regardless of the situation. IT HAS TO BE TAKE DOWN TO GET TO THE PERSON. if it was like zilean ult where you have to cast it on yourself then I can see that but it doesnt require that.

I don't think you're reading what everyone else is telling you regarding the cooldown difference.

compare the following:
I am playing karthus, It's like 30 minutes, I am somewhat on pace with items. My ult does about 60-70% of your max health in damage usually when this is the case.

I ult, you have GA. you get knocked into GA state. You revive. My ult goes on it's 2-3 minute cooldown. 
2-3 minutes later I ult again, **you die**. no GA, it's still on cooldown since it's 5 minutes to recharge and it's only been 2-3.

here's the other scenario:

I ult, you have zhonyas. You activate zhonyas. You go untargetable and take no damage from my ult. my ult goes on a 2-3 minute cooldown. You zhonyas goes on a 2 minute cooldown.
I ult again once off cooldown. You immediately zhonyas to respond because zhonyas cooldown is less cooldown than my ult. I literally **cannot kill you** with my ult ever unless someone else on my team pressures you into popping stasis. You can always choose not to and save your zhonyas specifically to counter my ult.

Honestly having it do it for you instead of having the freedom of activating it yourself is worse.

Everyone in the game would rather take it if it was an AD zhonyas, unquestionably.

Highly doubtful.

You can't be stunned out of using GA.  You can't be baited into using GA.  The enemy must commit enough resources to 100% kill you for it to activate at all.

I don’t see where the game needs specifically mages to be unkillable, so...no?

Because AP scalers get the following

- A spell shield on permanent standby

- Stasis

- Grievous Wounds

- An on-ability-damage slow effect

- Omnivamp for both physical and magic damage

the omnivamp has been severely nerfed in recent years to almost uselessness where it was once a common signt on many mages. 

Spell shield is honestly rarely usefull unless your enemies dont know how spellshields work, it's more useful on an assasin since they can usually get to an engagement before it gets popped where as most mages simply have it popped by relatively nothing before a battle starts since it's always up.

The on ability damage slow isnt even good and arent there items that cause basic attacks to slow as well? 

Grevious wounds counters people ho have a lot of lifesteal, mages aside from vlad (and new swain) never have any lifesteal, like yeah it counters healer supports but building an item simply to counter a support isnt reasonable.

yeah mages have stasis but ad has GA. Zhonyas takes a lot more thought to use well but has less cooldown and better stats.
